Articles.Content: So when I load my parts into KSP they look like they have some sort of lighting error, I think. It looks like they each have their own shadow that only effect that part. Check it out:

I assume you made your mesh in Blender, and set it to smooth shading, correct?

If so, you need to add (but do not apply) a EdgeSplit modifier set to 30~60 degrees, so that the cylindrical ends of the fuel tank are sharp, while the curved sides remain smooth.
No, I used Wings 3D to make my model and my collider, then I added the mesh collider component in Unity. I'll try the edgesplit in Wings if there's a tool for it.
When you import it to Unity, try setting Normals to Calculate rather than Import, if it's not already.

These glitches are due to the ends of the models having soft edges.
